docs.abstract: With businesses and personal finances hit hard by a loss of income, the first of the month may mean triage in deciding what to pay.
docs.snippet: With businesses and personal finances hit hard by a loss of income, the first of the month may mean triage in deciding what to pay.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, as on the first day of any month, many companies and households will have bills to pay. This time, a lot will simply pile up.

headline.main: April Bills Loom. The Economy Hangs on How Many Are Left Unpaid.
headline.print_headline: Hard Decisions For Americans As Bills Roll In

byline.original: By Conor Dougherty and Ben Casselman

docs.abstract: After spending billions to avoid a repeat of 2016, the tech giants are careening from crisis to crisis as their foes change tactics.
docs.snippet: After spending billions to avoid a repeat of 2016, the tech giants are careening from crisis to crisis as their foes change tactics.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The day after the New Hampshire primary last month, Facebook’s security team removed a network of fake accounts that originated in Iran, which had posted divisive partisan messages about the U.S. election inside private Facebook groups.

headline.main: Tech Giants Prepared for 2016-Style Meddling. But the Threat Has Changed.
headline.print_headline: Tech’s Battle to Handle the Election

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Kevin Roose, Sheera Frenkel and Nicole Perlroth

docs.abstract: The U.S. economic outlook darkens daily, with millions facing unemployment and businesses in a steep decline.
docs.snippet: The U.S. economic outlook darkens daily, with millions facing unemployment and businesses in a steep decline.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American economy is facing a plunge into uncharted waters.

headline.print_headline: A Recession Appears Certain as a Virus Wreaks Havoc

docs.abstract: The host of “Trish Regan Primetime” had said concerns about the coronavirus were “yet another attempt to impeach the president.”
docs.snippet: The host of “Trish Regan Primetime” had said concerns about the coronavirus were “yet another attempt to impeach the president.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The Fox Business anchor Trish Regan has departed the cable news network, two weeks after she was benched following an on-air monologue in which she dismissed concerns about the coronavirus as a “scam” fueled by enemies of President Trump.

headline.main: Trish Regan, Fox Business Host Who Dismissed Virus Concerns, Departs
headline.print_headline: Fox Business Anchor Leaves; Minimized Virus

docs.abstract: The Federal Reserve chair voiced a reassuring, if uncertain, message in a rare televised interview as the coronavirus grinds America’s economy to a halt.
docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve chair voiced a reassuring, if uncertain, message in a rare televised interview as the coronavirus grinds America’s economy to a halt.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, said during a rare television interview on Thursday that the United States “may well” be in a recession already, but that it should get the coronavirus under control before getting back to work.

headline.main: Fed’s Powell Says U.S. Must Get Virus Under Control Before Economy Restarts
headline.print_headline: Virus Will ‘Dictate’ Economy’s Restart, Powell Says

docs.abstract: The host of “Trish Regan Primetime” told viewers this week that concerns about the coronavirus were “yet another attempt to impeach the president.”
docs.snippet: The host of “Trish Regan Primetime” told viewers this week that concerns about the coronavirus were “yet another attempt to impeach the president.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The Fox Business anchor Trish Regan, whose on-air dismissal of the coronavirus as “another attempt to impeach the president” left her cable network facing a firestorm of criticism this week, has been removed from her prime-time slot for the foreseeable future, the network said on Friday.

headline.main: Fox Business Benches Trish Regan After Outcry Over Coronavirus Comments
headline.print_headline: Fox Business Sidelines Anchor Who Equated Virus to Impeachment

docs.abstract: The stimulus package includes more than $370 billion in government-backed bank loans that, in some cases, borrowers won’t have to repay.
docs.snippet: The stimulus package includes more than $370 billion in government-backed bank loans that, in some cases, borrowers won’t have to repay.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every day counts for Glynis Donnelly, who owns a jewelry store in Tampa, Fla. Ever since the coronavirus outbreak decimated foot traffic to her store, she has been using her savings to pay her eight part-time employees.

headline.main: Small Businesses Will Get Help Paying Workers, if They Can Wait
headline.print_headline: A Lifeline for Small Businesses Trying to Meet Payroll, if They Can Wait

docs.abstract: Can countries recover better from the pandemic-induced downturn by preventing companies and workers from going under to begin with? France is making a big bet.
docs.snippet: Can countries recover better from the pandemic-induced downturn by preventing companies and workers from going under to begin with? France is making a big bet.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — When France started shutting down a few weeks ago as the coronavirus marched relentlessly into the country, Dominique Paul feared disaster. His family’s white-glove catering company, Groupe Butard, halted operations, putting 190 jobs at risk.

headline.main: France Tries Limiting Joblessness to Confront Coronavirus Recession
headline.print_headline: France Bets on No Layoffs to Save the Economy

docs.abstract: Restrictions that follow current C.D.C. guidelines have become a source of tension at many stores supplying essential goods during the coronavirus pandemic.
docs.snippet: Restrictions that follow current C.D.C. guidelines have become a source of tension at many stores supplying essential goods during the coronavirus pandemic.
docs.lead_paragraph: At Office Depot, employees have been told that they cannot wear masks in the store. Some Walgreens workers say they were also discouraged from wearing them. Many other large retailers, including Target, have started to allow masks, but are leaving it up to employees to procure their own supplies.

headline.main: Retailers Under Growing Pressure to Let Workers Wear Masks
headline.print_headline: Fearing for Health, Retail Workers Battle Bosses to Wear Masks

byline.original: By Michael Corkery and Sapna Maheshwari

docs.abstract: Live updates on stock market and business news during the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.snippet: Live updates on stock market and business news during the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: This briefing is no longer updating. Read the latest developments in the coronavirus outbreak here.

headline.main: Retailers Under Pressure to Protect Workers
